intro: Glochidion curtisii, commonly known as the small-leaf glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Glochidion curtisii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and is often found in undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitats.
